frameDefinitions: An Agent acts so as to cause some process to begin again after an interruption or suspension.
An Entity that is previously not visible to a Perceiver becomes visible.
An Executive_authority exchanges one penalty, the Original_punishment, for another less severe one, the New_punishment.
An Agent resumes participation in an Activity.
An Agent is performing the portion of an Activity in which there is dynamic stability. '' 'Not noticing the hoards of people rushing by the window, Manny continued eating his lunch.'
An Agent pauses in the course of an Activity. '' 'The government froze settlement construction in 1992 to facilitate peace talks.'
frameExamples: The two countries <t>revived</t> diplomatic relations after a lull of five years.
The armada <t>appeared</t> on the horizon at sunset.
On December 15, 1971, Governor Winfield Dunn conditionally <t>commuted</t> his sentence to twenty years.
Normal Service Will Be <t>Resumed</t> Shortly. CNI
Not noticing the hoards of people rushing by the window, Manny <t>continued</t> eating his lunch.
The government <t>froze</t> settlement construction in 1992 to facilitate peace talks.
listRoleDefinitions: A sentient being acts with the intention of causing a process to begin again.
The process which begins again after a suspension.
The period of time during which the process is suspended.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that causes the process to resume. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of Causes.
The time at which the process is restarted.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the <fen>Process</fen> to resume.
The thing that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> is able to see or recognize.
A temporal description of the event of the <fen>Entity</fen> becoming visible.
The physical location in which the <fen>Entity</fen> becomes visible.
The constitutionally specified authority who has the power to commute punishments.
The punishment the <fen>Offender</fen> was originally sentenced to.
The time at which the <fen>Original_punishment</fen>  is commuted.
The location where the <fen>Executive_authority</fen> commutes the <fen>Original_punishment</fen>.
The <fen>Activity</fen> which is being resumed by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> who resumes an <fen>Activity</fen> that they were engaged in earlier.
When the Activity is resumed.
Where the event takes place.

Duration denotes the length of <fen>Time</fen> from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state.
This role identifies the name of the ongoing <fen>Activity</fen> in which an <fen>Agent</fen> engages.
The <fen>Agent</fen> engages in an ongoing <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when an ongoing <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the ongoing <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> for which an <fen>Agent</fen> is pausing.
An <fen>Agent</fen> pauses in the course of an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which an <fen>Agent</fen> pauses in the course of an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where an <fen>Agent</fen> pauses in the course of an <fen>Activity</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The driver</fex> restarted the truck after it stalled.
The two countries revived diplomatic relations <fex>after a lull of five years</fex>.
<fex>The spring rains</fex> restarted the flow of the stream.
This state reinstated the death penalty <fex>in 1975</fex>.
The two nations revived relations <fex>in Geneva</fex> during the latest round of talks.
Hearst was sentenced to seven years in prison. 1979, <fex>President Jimmy Carter</fex> commuted Hearst's prison sentence after she served nearly two years.
I had learned after all of this period of time has passed the court was about to let (Bush) pay a sum of money and commute <fex>her sentence</fex> to time served.
Israel <fex>yesterday</fex> commuted the lengthy prison terms of seven Jews convicted of murdering or plotting to kill Arabs.
We have renewed <fex>our efforts to gain federal recognition</fex>.
<fex>We</fex> renewed our efforts to get things completed.
